name: Introduction to Shakespeare Studies
description: This course introduces students to the world of Shakespeare and his works, and covers topics such as literature, theatre, and culture.

name: Shakespeare and the Early Modern Period
description: This course examines the life and works of Shakespeare in the context of the early modern period, from the Reformation to the Enlightenment.

name: Shakespeare and Language
description: This course explores the language of Shakespeare, from his use of rhetoric to his development of vocabulary.

name: Shakespeare and Genres
description: This course focuses on the various genres in which Shakespeare wrote, from comedies to tragedies to histories.

name: Shakespeare in Performance
description: This course examines Shakespeare's plays in performance, from the original Globe Theatre performances to modern interpretations.

name: Shakespeare in Context
description: This course explores the various historical, literary, and cultural contexts in which Shakespeare wrote and performed his works.
prerequisites: Shakespeare and the Early Modern Period
